definition: to act in a supporting role/fig. to play second fiddle
dozen (loanword)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: I don't mind playing second fiddle in this group.
sentences.chinese: 我不介意在這個組織裏打下手。

sentences.english: He is going to take service with Mr Smith, the merchant.
sentences.chinese: 他要去爲商人史密斯先生打下手。

sentences.english: I need someone by my side to help me.
sentences.chinese: 我需要有人在我旁邊幫我打下手。

sentences.english: Because there is no sense of taste, can master Chen cooking Kang Yuan bridges boy.
sentences.chinese: 因爲沒有味覺，只能陳師傅掌勺康遠橋打下手。
